intro: Endlichera, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia. The plants are characterized by their showy, often colorful flowers that resemble butterflies, hence their common name. They typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits. Endlichera species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
